nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: The objects of this Act are—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: to secure the health, safety and welfare of employees and other persons at work; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: to eliminate, at the source, risks to the health, safety or welfare of employees and other persons at work; and

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: to ensure that the health and safety of members of the public is not placed at risk by the conduct of undertakings by employers and self-employed persons; and

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: to provide for the involvement of employees, Occupational Health and Safety Act 2004 No. 107 of 2004 2 employers, and organisations representing those persons, in the formulation and implementation of...

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: It is the intention of the Parliament that in the administration of this Act regard should be had to the principles of health and safety protection set out in section 4.

nodes.label: Subsection 1
nodes.summary: To avoid doubt, a duty imposed on a person by this Part or the regulations to ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, health and safety requires the person—

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: to eliminate risks to health and safety so far as is reasonably practicable; and

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: if it is not reasonably practicable to eliminate risks to health and safety, to reduce those risks so far as is reasonably practicable.

nodes.label: Subsection 2
nodes.summary: To avoid doubt, for the purposes of this Part and the regulations, regard must be had to the following matters in determining what is (or was at a particular time) reasonably practicable in relation t...

nodes.label: Paragraph a
nodes.summary: the likelihood of the hazard or risk concerned eventuating;

nodes.label: Paragraph b
nodes.summary: the degree of harm that would result if the hazard or risk eventuated;

nodes.label: Paragraph c
nodes.summary: what the person concerned knows, or ought reasonably to know, about the hazard or risk and any ways of eliminating or reducing the hazard or risk;

nodes.label: Paragraph d
nodes.summary: the availability and suitability of ways to eliminate or reduce the hazard or risk;

nodes.label: Paragraph e
nodes.summary: the cost of eliminating or reducing the hazard Occupational Health and Safety Act 2004 No. 107 of 2004 25 or risk.
